authorsByline: Yuras Karmanau, The Washington Times https://www.washingtontimes.com
title: Belarus journalist is convicted of treason and jailed for 10 years as crackdown on dissent continues
description: A Belarusian journalist was convicted of treason and revealing state secrets and was sentenced to 10 years in prison after a closed trial, a media group said Friday, the eve of the fifth anniversary of a disputed election that kept authoritarian leader Alexander Lukashenko in power and unleashed mass protests.
content:
TALLINN, Estonia — A Belarusian journalist was convicted of treason and revealing state secrets and was sentenced to 10 years in prison after a closed trial, a media group said Friday, the eve of the fifth anniversary of a disputed election that kept authoritarian leader Alexander Lukashenko in power and unleashed mass protests.

Danil Palianski, who worked for several independent news agencies, was sentenced on July 25, but the trial’s outcome was only revealed Friday by the Belarusian Association of Journalists. In addition to the prison sentence, Palianski was fined the equivalent of about $7,000.

“Belarus has already become the black hole of Europe, where people are judged for words and thoughts,” said BAJ leader Andrei Bastunets.

Palianski, who was detained in September, is one of 37 journalists behind bars in Belarus.

His jailing is part of a sustained crackdown on government critics after unprecedented mass protests following Lukashenko’s disputed election on Aug. 9, 2020. Human rights groups say authorities have arrested more than 65,000 people, and hundreds of thousands more have fled the country in fear of persecution.

There are about 1,187 political prisoners in Belarus, including Nobel Peace Prize laureate and peace activist Ales Bialiatski, according to the human rights group Viasna, which he founded.
summary: A Belarusian journalist, Danil Palianski, has been convicted of treason and sentenced to 10 years in prison for revealing state secrets and working for several independent news agencies, after a closed trial. The verdict was only revealed by the Belarusian Association of Journalists (BAJ). In addition to the prison sentence, Paliansaki was fined about $7,000. This is part of a crackdown on dissent following the fifth anniversary of a disputed election that kept authoritarian leader Alexander Lukashenko in power and unleashed mass protests. Over 65,000 people have been arrested and hundreds of thousands have fled the country in fear of persecution. There are currently 37 journalists in Belarus, with about 1,187 political prisoners, including Nobel Peace Prize laureate Ales Bialiatski.
shortSummary: Belarusian journalist Danil Palianski was sentenced to 10 years for treason and revealing state secrets, amid a sustained crackdown following a disputed election.
